text.title: part4_Wikinews interviews Jim Hedges, U.S. Prohibition Party presidential candidate
text.p: Every day is different , but that ’s the basic schedule .

p.hi: What is your main source for political news ?

text.p:
( (
JH
) )
Three weekly newsmagazines :
The Economist
,
The Nation
, and
Science
.

p.hi: What is your biggest political concern at the moment ?

text.p:
( (
JH
) )
In the next 10 years , eliminating governmental deficits , primarily in the United States and in Europe . In the next 100 years , dealing with the social and economic consequences of the rise in sea level due to
climatic warming
.

p.hi:
How would you assess the presidencies of
George W. Bush
and
Barack Obama
?

text.p:
( (
JH
) )
Bush the Younger was unquestionably the most damaging president since
FDR
, perhaps the most damaging of all time : His "
Patriot Act
" and other security measures trashed the
Constitution
, our Constitution . His deficits have never been equaled . His foreign military adventures are the longest wars ever fought by our country .

Obama was dealt a miserable hand , but even so , I ’m becoming disappointed . We still have Bush‘s
deficit spending
. We still have
Bush ’s wars
. We still have Bush ’s failure to secure
the border with Mexico
. We still have Bush ’s
exporting American jobs overseas
. What is there to like ?

Obama did end Bush ’s "
global gag rule
, " which attempted to prevent family planning agencies all over the world from even discussing abortion . And he did make a stab at improving medical care .

p.hi:
What are your thoughts on
Sarah Palin
and the
Tea Party Movement
?

text.p:
( (
JH
) )
Palin was
given a job
for four years by the voters of Alaska . When she got bored with it ,
she handed the office key
to
her lieutenant governor
and walked away . That ’s not responsible behavior .

The Tea Party folks are on the right track in trying to get the federal budget deficit under control . I fear , though , that they lack the patience and flexibility to do the job gracefully . And , they ’re too easily distracted by unrelated issues .

p.hi:
What is your take on the the
health care bill
?

text.p:
( (
JH
) )
Obamacare is a step in the right direction , but it leaves intact the private insurance industry , which is a major source of waste . We need a
public health service
, like the one in England .

p.hi: What are some of your foreign policy views ?

text.p:
( (
JH
) )
America first ! Our unqualified
support for Israel
is doing us a great deal of damage elsewhere in the world . We need to stop all aid , both civilian and military , to Israel until Israel abides by the
Oslo Accords
.

We need to stop being the world ’s bully and , instead , lead by example : ratify
Kyoto
, ratify
CEDAW
, rein in the international corporations .

p.hi: What historical or contemporary figures do you identify with ?

text.p:
( (
JH
) )
You know , I think it would be appropriate to name
Jimmy Carter
. I did n’t always agree with what he did , but I could sympathize with why he did it . To the extent that any president can be , he was an honest , well-meaning person .
